intro: Isolepis gunnii, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This plant typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist to water-saturated soils. Its slender, grass-like stems are usually less than 30 cm tall, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Isolepis gunnii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms in its native wetland environments.
